definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey

sentences.english: Today, the most rich road to riches are among our most popular thing.
sentences.chinese: 今天，最发财致富之道都在我们最常用的东西之中。

sentences.english: Mr. Shaw made his fortune in the ring and on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 萧先生在拳击以及华尔街投资中发财致富。

sentences.english: My ambition is to make money and retire young.
sentences.chinese: 我的志向是发财致富，年轻时就退休。

sentences.english: Sutter was a Swiss. He had gone to America some years earlier to make his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 萨特是一位瑞士人，几年前他为了发财致富到了美国。

sentences.english: The next morning he was to start for the west to make his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他计划第二天早上动身到西部去发财致富。

definition: to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to become rich by one's own efforts/self-made
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
